repo: URL to repository; usually an API input
name: repository name = name of the module; usually an API input
spdx-license: usually an API input; if no SPDX identifier available, use 'alternative-license' with the URL to the legal code
licensor: person or organisation holding the IP rights
readme: relative link to README; usually an API input
technology-readiness-level: e.g. OTLR-4 for working prototypes in test environments or OTLR-5 for prototypes in real environments
function: short description of the module and what it does
patent-class: e.g. G05F 1/67, get it from here: https://www.wipo.int/classifications/ipc/ipcpub/?notion=search
tsdc-id: e.g. ASM-MEC (multiple); get it from here: https://gitlab.com/OSEGermany/oh-tsdc
simplified-bom: if in root dir. → just sBoM.csv
standard: name used standards (not DIN SPEC 3105) if applicable (multiple)
export: relative link to export file (multiple) or release
